title: Sentimental Cartography
summary:
Key ideas
- The author made a map of the rationalist community, which falls under the tradition of sentimental cartography.
- Sentimental cartography is a type of mapping abstract concepts into a visual format.
- The author shares some of the best examples of modern sentimental cartography by various artists.

Key learnings
- Sentimental cartography has been around since the Renaissance and was initially used for mapping sentiments, like love or sorrow.
- The art of sentimental cartography is currently not well-known and has very few modern examples.
- Some notable modern examples of sentimental cartography include maps created by James Turner, Martin Vargic, and an unnamed Reddit user.

Key questions
- What other abstract concepts could benefit from the visualization of sentimental cartography?
- Why do you think sentimental cartography hasn't been a more widely used technique, despite its potential as an art form?
- What challenges do artists face when creating sentimental cartography, both technically and ideologically?
